verses.verse: How <S%H349><s%> does the city <S%H5892><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> solitary, <S%H910><s%> that was full <S%H7227><s%> of people! <S%H5971><s%> how is she become <S%H1961><s%> as a widow! <S%H490><s%> she that was great <S%H7227><s%> among the nations, <S%H1471><s%> and princess <S%H8282><s%> among the provinces, <S%H4082><s%> how is she become <S%H1961><s%> tributary! <S%H4522><s%>

She weeps <S%H1058><s%> sore in the night, <S%H3915><s%> and her tears <S%H1832><s%> are on <S%H5921><s%> her cheeks: <S%H3895><s%> among all <S%H3605><s%> her lovers <S%H157><s%> she has none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> her: all <S%H3605><s%> her friends <S%H7453><s%> have dealt treacherously <S%H898><s%> with her, they are become <S%H1961><s%> her enemies. <S%H341><s%>

Judah <S%H3063><s%> is gone into <S%H1473><s%> captivity <S%H1540><s%> because of affliction, <S%H6040><s%> and because of great <S%H7230><s%> servitude: <S%H5656><s%> she dwells <S%H3427><s%> among the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> she finds <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> rest: <S%H4494><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her persecutors <S%H7291><s%> overtook <S%H5381><s%> her between <S%H996><s%> the straits. <S%H4712><s%>

The ways <S%H1870><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%> do mourn, <S%H57><s%> because none <S%H1097><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to the solemn <S%H4150><s%> feasts: <S%H4150><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her gates <S%H8179><s%> are desolate: <S%H8076><s%> her priests <S%H3548><s%> sigh, <S%H584><s%> her virgins <S%H1330><s%> are afflicted, <S%H3013><s%> and she is in bitterness. <S%H4843><s%>

Her adversaries <S%H6862><s%> are the chief, <S%H7218><s%> her enemies <S%H341><s%> prosper; <S%H7951><s%> for the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has afflicted <S%H3013><s%> her for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of her transgressions: <S%H6588><s%> her children <S%H5768><s%> are gone <S%H1980><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the enemy. <S%H6862><s%>

And from the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her beauty <S%H1926><s%> is departed: <S%H3318><s%> her princes <S%H8269><s%> are become <S%H1961><s%> like harts <S%H354><s%> that find <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> pasture, <S%H4829><s%> and they are gone <S%H3212><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> strength <S%H3581><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the pursuer. <S%H7291><s%>

Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of her affliction <S%H6040><s%> and of her miseries <S%H4788><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her pleasant <S%H4262><s%> things that she had <S%H1961><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> when her people <S%H5971><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the enemy, <S%H6862><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> did help <S%H5826><s%> her: the adversaries <S%H6862><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her, and did mock <S%H7832><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> her sabbaths. <S%H4868><s%>

Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> has grievously <S%H2399><s%> sinned; <S%H2398><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> she is removed: <S%H5206><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that honored <S%H3513><s%> her despise <S%H2107><s%> her, because <S%H3588><s%> they have seen <S%H7200><s%> her nakedness: <S%H6172><s%> yes, <S%H1571><s%> she sighs, <S%H584><s%> and turns <S%H7725><s%> backward. <S%H268><s%>

Her filthiness <S%H2932><s%> is in her skirts; <S%H7757><s%> she remembers <S%H2142><s%> not her last <S%H319><s%> end; therefore she came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> wonderfully: <S%H6382><s%> she had no <S%H369><s%> comforter. <S%H5162><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> behold <S%H7200><s%> my affliction: <S%H6040><s%> for the enemy <S%H341><s%> has magnified <S%H1431><s%> himself.

The adversary <S%H6862><s%> has spread <S%H6566><s%> out his hand <S%H3027><s%> on all <S%H3605><s%> her pleasant <S%H4261><s%> things: for she has seen <S%H7200><s%> that the heathen <S%H1471><s%> entered <S%H935><s%> into her sanctuary, <S%H4720><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> you did command <S%H6680><s%> that they should not enter <S%H935><s%> into your congregation. <S%H6951><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> her people <S%H5971><s%> sigh, <S%H584><s%> they seek <S%H1245><s%> bread; <S%H3899><s%> they have given <S%H5414><s%> their pleasant <S%H4262><s%> things for meat <S%H400><s%> to relieve <S%H7725><s%> the soul: <S%H5315><s%> see, <S%H7200><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and consider; <S%H5027><s%> for I am become <S%H1961><s%> vile. <S%H2151><s%>

Is it nothing <S%H3808><s%> to you, all <S%H3605><s%> you that pass <S%H5674><s%> by? behold, <S%H5027><s%> and see <S%H7200><s%> if <S%H518><s%> there be any sorrow <S%H4341><s%> like to my sorrow, <S%H4341><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is done <S%H5953><s%> to me, with which <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has afflicted <S%H3013><s%> me in the day <S%H3117><s%> of his fierce <S%H2740><s%> anger. <S%H639><s%>

From above <S%H4791><s%> has he sent <S%H7971><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> into my bones, <S%H6106><s%> and it prevails <S%H7287><s%> against them: he has spread <S%H6566><s%> a net <S%H7568><s%> for my feet, <S%H7272><s%> he has turned <S%H7725><s%> me back: <S%H268><s%> he has made <S%H5414><s%> me desolate <S%H8076><s%> and faint <S%H1739><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day. <S%H3117><s%>

The yoke <S%H5923><s%> of my transgressions <S%H6588><s%> is bound <S%H8244><s%> by his hand: <S%H3027><s%> they are wreathed, <S%H8276><s%> and come <S%H5927><s%> up on my neck: <S%H6677><s%> he has made my strength <S%H3581><s%> to fall, <S%H3782><s%> the LORD <S%H136><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> me into their hands, <S%H3027><s%> from whom I am not able <S%H3201><s%> to rise <S%H6965><s%> up.

The LORD <S%H136><s%> has trodden <S%H5541><s%> under foot <S%H5541><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my mighty <S%H47><s%> men in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of me: he has called <S%H7121><s%> an assembly <S%H4150><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me to crush <S%H7665><s%> my young <S%H970><s%> men: the LORD <S%H136><s%> has trodden <S%H1869><s%> the virgin, <S%H1330><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> as in a wine press. <S%H1660><s%>

For these <S%H428><s%> things I weep; <S%H1058><s%> my eye, <S%H5869><s%> my eye <S%H5869><s%> runs <S%H3381><s%> down with water, <S%H4325><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the comforter <S%H5162><s%> that should relieve <S%H7725><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> is far <S%H7368><s%> from me: my children <S%H1121><s%> are desolate, <S%H8076><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the enemy <S%H341><s%> prevailed. <S%H1396><s%>

Zion <S%H6726><s%> spreads <S%H6566><s%> forth her hands, <S%H3027><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> her: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has commanded <S%H6680><s%> concerning Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> that his adversaries <S%H6862><s%> should be round <S%H5439><s%> about him: Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> is as a menstruous <S%H5079><s%> woman among <S%H996><s%> them.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is righteous; <S%H6662><s%> for I have rebelled <S%H4784><s%> against his commandment: <S%H6310><s%> hear, <S%H8085><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, all <S%H3605><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> and behold <S%H7200><s%> my sorrow: <S%H4341><s%> my virgins <S%H1330><s%> and my young <S%H970><s%> men are gone <S%H1980><s%> into captivity. <S%H7628><s%>

I called <S%H7121><s%> for my lovers, <S%H157><s%> but they deceived <S%H7411><s%> me: my priests <S%H3548><s%> and my elders <S%H2205><s%> gave up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> in the city, <S%H5892><s%> while <S%H3588><s%> they sought <S%H1245><s%> their meat <S%H400><s%> to relieve <S%H7725><s%> their souls. <S%H5315><s%>

Behold, <S%H7200><s%> O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> for I am in distress: <S%H6887><s%> my bowels <S%H4578><s%> are troubled; <S%H2560><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> is turned <S%H2015><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me; for I have grievously <S%H4784><s%> rebelled: <S%H4784><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%> bereaves, <S%H7921><s%> at home <S%H1004><s%> there is as death. <S%H4194><s%>

They have heard <S%H8085><s%> that I sigh: <S%H584><s%> there is none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> me: all <S%H3605><s%> my enemies <S%H341><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> of my trouble; <S%H7451><s%> they are glad <S%H7797><s%> that you have done <S%H6213><s%> it: you will bring <S%H935><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> that you have called, <S%H7121><s%> and they shall be like <S%H3644><s%> to me.

Let all <S%H3605><s%> their wickedness <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you; and do <S%H5953><s%> to them, as you have done <S%H5953><s%> to me for all <S%H3605><s%> my transgressions: <S%H6588><s%> for my sighs <S%H585><s%> are many, <S%H7227><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> is faint. <S%H1742><s%>
